intro: Vittadinia conyzoides, commonly known as the common vittadinia, is an annual herb native to Australia. It is characterized by its hairy stems and alternate leaves that are typically lance-shaped. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late winter to early spring. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and grasslands. Vittadinia conyzoides is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to spread rapidly through seeds.
